brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of brimonidine tartrate
      0.025% ophthalmic solution used four times daily in a population of adult and geriatric
      subjects

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Brimonidine Tartrate Ophthalmic Solution in Adult and Geriatric Subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Be at least 40 years of age

          -  Must have normal ocular health

          -  Must have history of redness relief drop use or desire to use

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Must not have any ocular/systemic health problems

          -  Must agree to avoid disallowed medications

intervention.description: 1 drop in each eye daily for up to 35 days
1 drop in each eye for up to 35 days

clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Center, Double-Masked, Randomized, Vehicle-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Brimonidine Tartrate Ophthalmic Solution in Adult and Geriatric Subjects

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: redness evaluated by investigator prior to study medication instillation and redness evaluated by the subject as captured in dosing diary
primary_outcome.time_frame: at specified timepoints for up to 180 minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: evaluated prior to study medication instillation and at 5 minutes post instillation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 minutes post study medication instillation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
